openpas.basics

Interface NumericResolver

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ProbabilityComputer, SymbolicResolver

    public interface NumericResolver
extends SymbolicResolver, ProbabilityComputer
    Numeric resolver is a do-all interface for all analytical operations in a PAS system. It achieves this by extending the two other fundamental interface for symbolic resolution and probability computation. This is done mainly for the convenience of the developer otherwise one would have to rely on three interfaces to get access to the analytics. The numeric resolver itself defines the fundamental methods to calculated the degrees of support for the various support definitions.

    • Method Detail

      • calcDQS

        double calcDQS(Expressions.SimpleSentence<LogicalOps.LogicalAnd,LogicalOps.LogicalOr> hypothesis)
        Calculate the degree of quasi-support (dqs) for the given hypothesis.
        Parameters:
        hypothesis -
        Returns:

      • calcDQS_I

        double calcDQS_I()
        Calculate the degree of quasi-support for inconsistency. This is typically needed as an input to the degree of support calculations (e.g. #calcNormalisedDSP(SimpleSentence)) as follows:
        $dqs(h, \xi) = \frac{dqs(h,\xi) - dqs(\bot, \xi)}{1 - dqs(\bot, \xi}$
        where $\xi$ is the knowledgebase, h is the hypothesis, $\bot$ is falsity, and so $dqs(\bot, \xi}$ is the dqs for inconsistency (ie. the return value from this method).
        This implementation may cache the result for the return value here since it's a constant for a PAS instance, and doesn't change with varying hypotheses. ref: HKL2000, p25
        Returns:

      • calcNonNormalisedDSP

        double calcNonNormalisedDSP(Expressions.SimpleSentence<LogicalOps.LogicalAnd,LogicalOps.LogicalOr> hypothesis)
        Calculate the unnormalised degree of support, such that:
        $dqs_u(h, \xi) = dqs(h,\xi) - dqs(\bot, \xi)$
        where $\xi$ is the knowledgebase, h is the hypothesis, and $\bot$ is falsity. This operation may involve first calculating the calcDQS_I() and then using this value as above.
        Parameters:
        hypothesis -
        Returns:

      • calcNormalisedDSP

        double calcNormalisedDSP(Expressions.SimpleSentence<LogicalOps.LogicalAnd,LogicalOps.LogicalOr> hypothesis)
        This calculates the degree of support for a given hypothesis. This is defined as follows: $dqs(h, \xi) = \frac{dqs(h,\xi) - dqs(\bot, \xi)}{1 - dqs(\bot, \xi}$
        where $\xi$ is the knowledgebase, h is the hypothesis, and $\bot$ is falsity. ref: HKL2000, p25 This operation may involve first calculating the calcDQS_I() and then using this value as above.
        Parameters:
        hypothesis -
        Returns:
